channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-5298] Add thrift metrics to thrift2
item.description:
We have added thrift metrics collection in HBASE-5186.
It will be good to have them in thrift2 as well.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
sc requested code review of "HBASE-5298 [jira] Add thrift metrics to thrift2".
Reviewers: tedyu, JIRA

Add thrift metrics to thrift2

We have added thrift metrics collection in HBASE-5186.
It will be good to have them in thrift2 as well.

TEST PLAN
EMPTY

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D1629

AFFECTED FILES
src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/CallQueue.java
src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/ThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java
src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/ThriftMetrics.java
src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/ThriftServer.java
src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/TestCallQueue.java
src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/TestThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java

MANAGE HERALD DIFFERENTIAL RULES
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/view/differential/

WHY DID I GET THIS EMAIL?
https://reviews.facebook.net/herald/transcript/3459/

Tip: use the X-Herald-Rules header to filter Herald messages in your client.

tedyu has commented on the revision "HBASE-5298 [jira] Add thrift metrics to thrift2".

Can we reuse the classes, CallQueue and ThriftMetrics, from src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift ?

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D1629

sc has commented on the revision "HBASE-5298 [jira] Add thrift metrics to thrift2".

I thought about that also. I was just not sure if there can be dependency between thrift and thrift2. I don't understand thrift2 enough.

Thanks for the comment Ted. I will make the change and update the patch soon.

REVISION DETAIL
https://reviews.facebook.net/D1629

src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/thrift2/TestThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java:583 Should we check whether DEBUG is enabled before entering the loop ?
